alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Coastal; Mobile Coastal (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 3:49AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mobile and southwestern Baldwin Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 348 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Fort Morgan, or 14 miles southeast of Dauphin Island, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bayou La Batre, Fort Morgan, Coden and Alabama Port. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
